simulation.agent

Interface Agent

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Listener, Speaker
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    VariantAgent, WeightedLexiconAgent
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SuccessCountingAgent, TotalListener, TotalSpeaker

    public interface Agent
extends Speaker, Listener
    An interface providing all methods expected to be defined for different kinds of agents in naming games in computer models of language evolution.
    See Also:
    Listener, Speaker, VariantAgent, Lexicon

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Map<Language,java.lang.Integer> countDominatingWords(java.util.Collection<Language> languages)
      Returns a map from the given collection of languages to integers such that each language is mapped to the number of dominating words in this agent's lexicon
      static java.util.Map<Language,java.lang.Integer> countRecognizedThings(java.util.Collection<Language> languages, Agent[] agents)
      Returns a map from the given collection of languages to integers such that each language is mapped to the number of things recognized by any agent from the given array of agents in association with a word belonging to this language.
      static java.util.Map<Language,java.lang.Integer> countUsers(java.util.Collection<Language> languages, Agent[] agents)
      Returns a map from the given collection of languages to integers such that each language is mapped to the number of agents from the given array for which this language is dominating.
      Language dominatingLanguage(java.util.Collection<Language> languages)
      Returns the dominating language of this agent from among the specified collection of languages.
      static boolean lexicallySynchronized(Agent[] agents, Environment environment)
      Returns true if all agents from the given array are pair-wise lexically synchronized on the given environment.
      static boolean lexicallySynchronized(Agent a, Agent b, Environment environment)
      Returns true if the two specified agents are lexically synchronized on the given environment.
      boolean oneToOneLexicon()
      Returns true if each thing recognized by this agent is denoted by only one word.
      static boolean oneToOneLexicons(Agent[] agents)
      Returns true if all agents from the given array are evaluated to true with oneToOneLexicon() method.
      boolean recognized(Thing thing)
      Returns true if this agent recognizes the specified thing with a word.
      java.util.Map<Language,java.util.Collection<Thing>> recognizedThings(java.util.Collection<Language> languages)
      Returns a map from the given collection of languages to collections of things such that each language is mapped to the collection of things recognized with the words belonging to it in this agent's lexicon

        loss, randomRecognizedThing, signal, success

      • Methods inherited from interface simulation.agent.Listener

    • Method Detail

      • recognized

        boolean recognized(Thing thing)
        Returns true if this agent recognizes the specified thing with a word.
        Parameters:
        thing - a thing to be checked for recognition
        Returns:
        true if this agent recognizes the specified thing with a word; false otherwise.

      • oneToOneLexicon

        boolean oneToOneLexicon()
        Returns true if each thing recognized by this agent is denoted by only one word. More formally, it returns true if this agent's lexicon can be described as an injective function from the space of recognized things to the space of words.
        Returns:
        true if each thing recognized by this agent is denoted by only one word; false otherwise.

      • dominatingLanguage

        Language dominatingLanguage(java.util.Collection<Language> languages)
        Returns the dominating language of this agent from among the specified collection of languages.
        Parameters:
        languages - a collection of languages to be checked for dominating language
        Returns:
        the dominating language of this agent from among the specified collections of languages.

      • countDominatingWords

        java.util.Map<Language,java.lang.Integer> countDominatingWords(java.util.Collection<Language> languages)
        Returns a map from the given collection of languages to integers such that each language is mapped to the number of dominating words in this agent's lexicon
        Parameters:
        languages - a collection of languages to be a domain of returned map
        Returns:
        a map between languages and numbers such that each language from the specified collection of languages is mapped to the number of dominating words in this agent's lexicon

      • recognizedThings

        java.util.Map<Language,java.util.Collection<Thing>> recognizedThings(java.util.Collection<Language> languages)
        Returns a map from the given collection of languages to collections of things such that each language is mapped to the collection of things recognized with the words belonging to it in this agent's lexicon
        Parameters:
        languages - a collection of languages to be a domain of returned map
        Returns:
        a map between languages and numbers such that each language from the specified collection of languages is mapped to the collection of things recognized with the words belonging to it in this agent's lexicon

      • lexicallySynchronized

        static boolean lexicallySynchronized(Agent[] agents,
                                     Environment environment)
        Returns true if all agents from the given array are pair-wise lexically synchronized on the given environment.
        Parameters:
        agents - an array of agents to be checked for lexical synchronization on the given environment
        environment - an environment on which the given array of agents should be checked for lexical synchronization
        Returns:
        true if all agents from the given array are pair-wise lexically synchronized on the things from the given environment; false otherwise.

      • lexicallySynchronized

        static boolean lexicallySynchronized(Agent a,
                                     Agent b,
                                     Environment environment)
        Returns true if the two specified agents are lexically synchronized on the given environment.
        Parameters:
        a - the first agent to be checked for lexical synchronization
        b - the second agent to be checked for lexical synchronization
        environment - an environment on which the two specified agents should be checked for lexical synchronization
        Returns:
        true if the two specified agents are lexically synchronized on the given environment; false otherwise.

      • countUsers

        static java.util.Map<Language,java.lang.Integer> countUsers(java.util.Collection<Language> languages,
                                                            Agent[] agents)
        Returns a map from the given collection of languages to integers such that each language is mapped to the number of agents from the given array for which this language is dominating.
        Parameters:
        languages - a collection of languages to be a domain of returned map
        agents - an array of agents from which numbers of users of languages from the given collection should be counted
        Returns:
        a map from the given collection of languages to integers such that each language is mapped to the number of agents from the given array for which this language is dominating.

      • countRecognizedThings

        static java.util.Map<Language,java.lang.Integer> countRecognizedThings(java.util.Collection<Language> languages,
                                                                       Agent[] agents)
        Returns a map from the given collection of languages to integers such that each language is mapped to the number of things recognized by any agent from the given array of agents in association with a word belonging to this language.
        Parameters:
        languages - a collection of languages to be a domain of returned map
        agents - an array of agents to be included in evaluation of the mappings to collections of recognized things
        Returns:
        a map from the given collection of languages to integers such that each language is mapped to the number of things recognized by any agent from the given array of agents in association with a word belonging to this language.

      • oneToOneLexicons

        static boolean oneToOneLexicons(Agent[] agents)
        Returns true if all agents from the given array are evaluated to true with oneToOneLexicon() method.
        Parameters:
        agents - an array of agents to be checked for evaluation to true with oneToOneLexicon() method
        Returns:
        true if all agents from the given array are evaluated to true with oneToOneLexicon() method.
